meanings.definition: To remove or dismiss someone from a job due to redundancy.
meanings.sent1: The company excessed several employees after the merger.
meanings.sent2: She was excessed from her position when the department downsized.
meanings.sent3: The robot was excessed from its role as it kept making mistakes.
meanings.sent4: After the budget cuts, many staff members felt excessed from their roles.
meanings.sent5: The teacher excessed the student from the class for disruptive behavior.

meanings.definition: More than what is considered necessary or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: He bought an excessed amount of candy at the store.
meanings.sent2: The excessed luggage was too heavy for the flight.
meanings.sent3: The excessed decorations made the room look cluttered.
meanings.sent4: Her excessed enthusiasm for the project was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The excessed food at the party went to waste.

meanings.definition: The act of exceeding a limit or boundary.
meanings.sent1: The excessed of the speed limit resulted in a ticket.
meanings.sent2: His constant excessed of the noise level annoyed his neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The excessed of the time allocated caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent4: The excessed of the river's banks led to flooding in the area.
meanings.sent5: The excessed of the weight limit on the elevator caused it to malfunction.
